column4: Hi all.  I just installed Breezy Beaver and I'm having a problem with the panel at the bottom of the screen.
None of my applications are showing up in the panel.
reboot
one other note about my panel problem... I imported my home directory from my other machine that was running Warty Warthog.  Would that have any effect on my current panel settings?
did you just upgrade to breezy ?
No, its a fresh install on a new machine.  I tar-ed up my home dir from another machine and ftp-ed it over and untar-ed it.
who owns the files in /home/user/ now ?
warty was the latest release when I installed on my old machine.  Never upgraded to hedgehog or beaver.
root owns the tarball, but I own my home directory and all the files/dirs underneath.
double check permissions and software versions
and if it all matches, check again :)
how do I check software versions?
it'd be faster to tar up what you need and move that across
maybe I'll do that.  what specific dirs do I *not* need?
or what dirs should I not overwrite?
well I would simply copy the files you have downloaded or specifically authored(openoffice, images)
unless you have some bookmarks you *must* retain, then copying all the .xxx settings across is going to cause grief
can I just reinstall the panel using the package manager?
will that fix things or will there be other stuff that's messed up?
well if your new machine is working, and its apps are all working. simply adding a openoffice, movie, mp3 and images into your home directory wont cause any problems
copy configuration files from one computer to another, where the software installed and its versions are not exactly the same is bound to have problems
yeah, I did include all the .* dirs from my home directory.  I haven't run into any problems other than the panel (yet).  I'm thinking that reinstalling the panel should fix things.  No?
